Review Text: I arrived at the PS at 1:33 pm (Password removed from Totem). The first medical care took place at around 2:25 pm - at that time, the initial symptoms were much worse. My husband was with me and was completely outraged, however, the doctor's response was that it was a system failure for not locating my tests, and in fact, if I didn't speak up I would leave without the ATB prescription. As if this whole situation wasn't enough, the preliminary CT report shows the presence of the IUD, which was removed in November/23 by a doctor at the São Luiz Itaim outpatient clinic. Total disrespect for the patient - 8 hours waiting for poor quality care.The next day I went to another institution, my tests were much worse and already showed changes in PCR, Creatinine, Potassium and others.

Sheila, the service coordinator, was very helpful in helping me correct the situation: I would get a new exam guide and a new date so that I could take the exam without missing the doctor's appointment, which was already scheduled. She never returned. When I got in touch and managed to speak to her, she hung up on me. I managed to book the exam elsewhere and almost couldn't take it because they forgot to cancel the approval password for the agreement. Regrettable. Not the error in the doctor's schedule, because to make mistakes is human, but pretending that it was going to help and then having the courage to hang up on him was disrespectful. Forgetting to cancel the agreement password, no matter what. In addition to not helping, they also hindered.
